result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendrick Savion Mcgahee

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Defendant Kendrick Savion Mcgahee in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Kendrick Savion Mcgahee.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Judge Flugaur is also present, in Court.

Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

The State filed an amended information.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will enter a plea to the single charge, deferred entry of judgment agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

Defendant enters a plea of: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court accepts the plea of guilty of Count 1. 
Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of  judgment of conviction this date.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement.

Defendant has an appointment with the coordinator for next week.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Court questions the defendant if he is familiar with the terms of his bond. 
Defendant indicates he is. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kendrick Savion Mcgahee in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Kendrick Savion Mcgahee. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:43 PM Defendant Kendrick Savion Mcgahee appeared in court.  Atty Anne Renc appears on behalf of the Defendant for Atty Maxwell Bergner.   Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Brian Pfeil, appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC w/Intent to Deliver. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner states objections as to bond. 

BY THE COURT: Court sets bond
